item.description:
ADIRONDACK HP SERIES:

Whiteface Mountain and Esther Mountain, via the Old Marble Mountain Ski Trail and the Wilmington Trail, From the Atmospheric Sciences Research Center / Whiteface Mountain Observatory parking area and the Old Marble Mountain Ski Trail trailhead,Through Hike to Conner Pond Road (Off NY Route 86).


 LAKE PLACID, NY ...

HOME BASE OF THE WINTER OLYMPICS!

 

HIKE IT!

Review ALL the details below ...


EVENT ORGANIZER: Julie Moran Contact me here: jmmoran {{ AT }} nycap.rr.com, Mobile 518-281-5882 (PLEASE, NO PHONE CALLS UNTIL THE WEEKEND OF THE EVENT). Please feel free to email me with your thoughts and your questions about this trip.

 

Total Mileage, Total Elevation Gain, Estimated Hike Times: About 12.3 miles, about 3,403' ASL vertical climbing; plan on an average 8 1/4-hours hike time.  See map below!

 

BAD WEATHER DATE: The following day (Sunday, September 2nd).


SPECIAL GEAR REQUIREMENTS: Dress in non-wicking layers; bring insect repellent and sunscreen. Be sure to try out your gear before you start out ... bring extra batteries and test your lights!  Trekking poles will be helpful for this hike.


CLICK HERE: Google map link from Concord NH to the meetup / car spot location to

  • (A) Meetup  location in Lake Placid:  Sunoco station, corner of NY Routes 73 and 86; and
  • (B) The car spot on Connery Pond Road, then to
  • (C) The hike start:  The Atmospheric Sciences Research Center / Whiteface Mountain Observatory parking area and the Old Marble Mountain Ski Trail trailhead, Marble Mountain Road, off of NY Route 17 (Whiteface Memorial Highway).

PLEASE TEST THIS LINK BEFORE YOU GO ... DIRECT QUESTIONS VIA EMAIL BEFORE THE EVENT ... IT'S YOUR RESPONSIBILITY TO KNOW WHERE WE ARE MEETING.

 

CLICK HERE: TRIP PLANNER (view / print / take with you).

Click on the "Old Marble-Wilmington Tr.-Rt 86" tab at the bottom of the page.

It might be easier to print if you can copy and paste the spreadsheet data into a document.


This is a DOG-FRIENDLY event (and as always, Mike is  coming!!!) ... if you don't like dogs, sorry ... this event isn't for you!


Whiteface Mountain is amazing for its volcanic like shape, visibility and its autonomous position relative to the other Adirondack High Peaks. Here's a view of the mountain from Azure Mountain quite a distance away.

 

EVENT SUMMARY / UPDATES

(08/23/2012  7 p.m.):

  • This 12.3-mile traverse includes a visit to the summit of Whiteface Mountain, fifth highest mountain in New York state and namesake to a world famous ski resort and home of two Winter Olympics.  It also includes a hike to nearby Esther Mountain, the only Adirondack High Peak named for a woman, Esther McComb, who made the first recorded climb to the summit in 1839, at age 15 ... at the time she was attempting to climb Whiteface Mountain from the north.
  • The summit of Whiteface Mountain is also accessible by a toll road, and includes an upper stone observation tower linked by an elevator to a lower building that offers a snack bar and sundries shop.  The summit of Esther Mountain is accessed by an unmarked but well traversed herd path.
  • Please review all the information here and direct all questions BEFORE you go ... YOU ARE THE LEADER OF YOUR OWN HIKE ... and remember, there is a car spot and 25-minute drive to the hike start.  I'll be with Mike so I need someone to do a shuttle with Mike in their car -- in advance, thank you for your help.

 

WEB LINKS FOR ADDITIONAL INFORMATION


Overview of Whiteface Mountain Resort and the Region

  • www.whiteface.com -- Resort Pages
  • www.LakePlacid.com -- Shopping, restaurants, lodging, photos, etc.
  • www.lake-placid.ny.us -- Overall information on the area.

 

Whiteface Mountain

  • SummitPost
  • Peakbagger
  • ALavigne.net
  • Peakery


Esther Peak

  • SummitPost
  • Peakbagger
  • ALavigne.net
  • Peakery


Here's a map of the entire hike!

Click on it ... print it ... and take it with you ...

Be patient, IMAGE IS LARGE!

 

Another summit view from Whiteface Mountain, showing the stone weather observation tower.  A lower stone building offers a snack and sundries shop.


Your organizer and best friend Mike, on the summit of Whiteface Mountain.


THE FINE PRINT -- NOTE: You are responsible for bringing appropriate gear, supplies, clothing, first aid and lights. You should review topographic maps and trail features carefully; understanding topography of any challenge hike is key to your knowing where you are, where you're going and how to get back.

WEATHER AND OTHER SUDDEN EVENTS CAN CAUSE SUDDEN CHANGES TO OR CANCELLATION OF THIS EVENT. YOU MUST CHECK BACK TO THE MEETUP.COM SITE OFTEN FOR UPDATES TO ANY HUDSON VALLEY HIKER EVENT. BY ATTENDING YOU'VE AGREED THAT YOU'VE READ INFORMATION PRESENTED HERE AND AT OUR GUIDELINES -- CLICK THE "ABOUT" LINK AT LEFT.

See suggestions for GEAR on the "About" page for additional gear ideas. See you there! Julie. 

You agree when you sign up for this group or any of the events that you have read and understand the below. If you join us for a hike (or any other event), please understand that you are responsible for your own preparedness and well-being and will hold no one else liable in case of injury or mishap. You agree not to hold the Organizer, Assistant Organizers, or any other members responsible for any injuries, mishaps, or any other situation that may happen at a planned event. You are responsible to research the event, know the area, and bring the proper gear. Your attendance on a hike signifies that you have read and accept the terms of this liability waiver. The full waiver can be found on the HVH LEGAL DISCLAIMER page.
item.how_to_find_us: Look for the Green Honda Element ...
item.name: ADK 46er Series: Whiteface Mountain Traverse + Esther Peak (two 4000'ers!)
